label: OTOROKU
description:
Sunik Kim's new album is a frantic conflation of giddy General MIDI instrumentation, homespun RPG fantasies and Henry Cow's inaccessible freeform improvisation. Cyborg music for the information age's dying gasps - RIYL Stockhausen, James Ferraro, Roland Kayn or Carl Stone.

Within seconds of the 23-minute opening side, Kim drags us into a sonic biodome powered by haphazard, fictile orchestral blasts, redlined, stuttering percussion and tinny, 16-bit videogame fanfares. It's not... more

title_full:
RP Boo

              —
              Legacy Volume 2
            
              (Planet Mu Records Ltd.)
label: Planet Mu Records Ltd.
description:
Chicago footwork catalyst RP Boo shells archival zingers on a 10 year follow-up to his first album for Planet Mu.

‘Legacy Volume 2’ hails the happiest man in footwork with 13 stuttering shots spanning tunes found on the groundbreaking ‘Bangs & Works’ compilation thru to unreleased material produced during footwork’s formative years 2002-2007. Justifiably claimed as “to footwork what Juan Atkins is to techno”, RP Boo can also rightly be heard as its Dilla or Pete Rock for his innovative... more

title_full:
Historically Fucked

              —
              The Mule Peasants’ Revolt of 12,067
            
              (Upset The Rhythm)
label: Upset The Rhythm
description:
Manchester’s elite free jazz/rock miscreants David Birchall, Otto Willberg, Greta Buitkuté, and Alecs Pierce howl and flail with a highly disciplined sort of skronky madness on a reprisal of styles found on their Heavy Petting label - think Mr. Bungle and Laurie Tompkins meets Diamanda Galas at Vymethoxy Redspiders’ lair

“Historically Fucked is a four way entanglement made to create short, eruptive songs and then set about obliterating them from the inside, like improvising a... more

label: Heat Crimes
description: Turntablist and composer Mariam Rezaei completes her ambitious, pithy triptych with 'BOWN', her debut for the Heat Crimes imprint. Flipping the concept of turntable-based music on its head, she fractures free jazz, noise, death drone and operatic fragments into a broken tangle of spinbacks, pitchbends, loping rhythms and perverted side-eyes. Featuring collaborations with Teresa Winter, Luka Koenig, Alya Al-Sultani, Bobby Glue and Gwily Edmondez, it's crucial listening for anyone into Maria... more

label: Them There Records
description:
Right at the intersection of HTRK’s lilting heartbreak, Tirzah’s soul diffractions and Tricky’s Pre Millennial tension, Manchester's Hyperdawn aka Vitalija Glovackytė and Michael Cutting arrive with a hugely satisfying new album, a boldly experimental slice of asymmetric cybeR&B laced with slippery vocal hooks x vibe-shifted, concrète production.

We begin with a gorgeous, minimal turn on 'Say it so', playing with loose vocals smeared over a lucid canvas until it all starts to glitch erratically over... more
